name: df-rngcALTV
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7
body: |- wceq(crngcALTV, cmpt(s0, universe, csb(s1, cin(cv(s0), crng), ctp(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cv(s1)), cop(cfv(chom, cnx), cmpo(s2, s3, cv(s1), cv(s1), co(cv(s2), crngh, cv(s3)))), cop(cfv(cco, cnx), cmpo(s4, s5, cxp(cv(s1), cv(s1)), cv(s1), cmpo(s6, s7, co(cfv(c2nd, cv(s4)), crngh, cv(s5)), co(cfv(c1st, cv(s4)), crngh, cfv(c2nd, cv(s4))), ccom(cv(s6), cv(s7)))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ RngCatALTV =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶[(s0 ‚ãÇ Rng)/ s1]{ <(Base ` ndx), s1 >, <(Hom ` ndx),(s2 ‚àà s1, s3 ‚àà s1 ‚Ü¶(s2[RngHomo]s3))>, <(comp ` ndx),(s4 ‚àà(s1 √ó s1), s5 ‚àà s1 ‚Ü¶(s6 ‚àà((2nd ` s4)[RngHomo]s5), s7 ‚àà((1st ` s4)[RngHomo](2nd ` s4))‚Ü¶(s6 ‚àò s7)))> })
comment: Definition of the category Rng, relativized to a subset ` u ` . This is the category of all non-unital rings in ` u ` and homomorphisms between these rings. Generally, we will take ` u ` to be a weak universe or Grothendieck universe, because these sets have closure properties as good as the real thing. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by AV, 27-Feb-2020.)
